alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 8:02PM CDT until May 19 at 4:36AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Colorado, Fort Bend, Austin and Wharton Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Monday was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.2 feet on 11/06/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 20.4 Mon 7 pm CDT 20.6 18.8 16.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 800 AM CDT.
